title: 109_hr377
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Every Requirement of Exemplary Service Act of 2005" or the "HEROES Act of 2005". Death gratuity enhancements are included in the Act. The "HEROES Act of 2005" includes death gratuity enhancements, with a death gratuity of $100,000 for combat-related deaths. The death gratuity under the "HEROES Act of 2005" is $100,000 for combat-related deaths, with increases linked to basic pay rates. The death gratuity amount is amended to include death gratuities under subsections (a) and (c). Subsection (a) is further amended to adjust under subsection (d). Additionally, there is a requirement to pay an additional gratuity for deaths before the effective date. The Secretary of the military department shall pay an additional death gratuity for members of the Armed Forces who died before the effective date, in addition to the gratuity already payable under existing laws. The Secretary of the military department shall pay an additional death gratuity for members of the Armed Forces who died before the effective date, in addition to the gratuity already payable under existing laws. The requirements of this subsection apply to members who died before the enactment of this Act as a direct result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom, or as described in section 1413a(e)(2) of title 10, United States Code, on or after October 7, 2001. The additional death gratuity of $238,000 is payable to beneficiaries of members who died as a result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom, or as described in section 1413a(e)(2) of title 10, United States Code, on or after October 7, 2001. The additional death gratuity is payable to beneficiaries of members who died due to specific circumstances. If there are multiple beneficiaries, the amount each receives is based on the ratio of their regular military death gratuity share to the total regular military death gratuity payable. The additional death gratuity is provided to beneficiaries of deceased members under specific circumstances, with the amount each beneficiary receives based on their regular military death gratuity share. The regular military death gratuity is a payment under certain sections of the United States Code. SEC. 3. SERVICEMEMBERS' GROUP LIFE INSURANCE ENHANCEMENTS. Increased maximum amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance to $400,000 or a lesser amount chosen by the member, with additional coverage for certain members. The maximum amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance is increased to $400,000 or a lesser amount chosen by the member, with additional coverage for certain members serving in specific areas or operations. The maximum amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance is increased to $400,000 or a lesser amount chosen by the member, with additional coverage for members who die as a result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred while serving in designated combat operations or zones. The Secretary designates combat operations or zones for additional insurance coverage of $150,000 for members who die as a direct result of injuries or illnesses incurred while serving in those designated areas. The insurance coverage provided for a member is $150,000, but it may be reduced if the member has additional coverage exceeding $250,000. The total insurance payable for a member cannot exceed $400,000. During designated operations, the insurance cost for the member is attributed to $150,000 of insurance. The insurance cost for a member under this subchapter is attributed to $150,000 of insurance coverage and cannot be deducted from the member's pay. Funding for members serving in designated operations is outlined in section 1969(b)(2) of the title. The insurance cost for a member under this subchapter is $150,000 and cannot be deducted from the member's pay. Funding for members serving in designated operations is outlined in section 1969(b)(2) of the title. Amendments are made to section 1967(a)(2)(A) regarding insurance provisions. Amendments are made to increase insurance coverage to $400,000 and clarify coordination with Veterans' Group Life Insurance. Amendments to Section 1967(a) of the title include requirements for members to elect insurance coverage under certain regulations prescribed by the Secretary of Defense. Amendments to Section 1967(a) of the title include requirements for members to elect insurance coverage under regulations prescribed by the Secretary of Defense. The spouse of a member must receive insurance coverage equal to or greater than the maximum amount provided under subparagraph (A)(i)(I). A member with a spouse cannot opt out of insurance coverage without the spouse's written consent. The new subsection (j) in Section 1970 of the title states that a member with a spouse cannot change beneficiaries without the spouse's written consent. This section and its amendments will take effect more than 90 days after the enactment of the Act.
